page.title: 13LANGUAGE AND DIALECT
page.content: Within the Dale a mixture of dialects may be heard. There are very few original Yorkshire families left. ROSEDALE probably from RUSSI or ROSSI'S VALLEY. Old Norse RHOS means horse. HARTOFT. HARETOFT _ HARE?TOFT or HAR meaning hoary or stoney. Farm in stoney or rocky place. Old Norse. HEYGATE _ hay enclosure, hunting enclosure. Old Norse. RUSSDAL in 1130 1152.ROSSEDAL in 1186. GATES FARM known locally as YATTS FARM BRAMBLES not BLACKBERRIES BLUEBERRIES are BILBERRIES GOLDINGS are the stalks left after the heather has been burnt. SEAVES(pronounced SEEAVES) are REEDS PEEWIT is a PLOVER. MUCK is MANURE. LEADING hay or straw is MOVING it from one place to another.
